N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 6 ยง 421.2 - Permit term and fees

State Regulations
(a) Applications
for permits may be submitted for annual terms not to exceed five
years. (b) All persons required to
obtain a permit or approval or subject to regulation under this Title shall
submit annually to the department a fee in the amount to be determined for
affected land as follows: (1)
$400 for minor
projects; or
(2)
$700 for affected
land of an acreage equal to or less than five acres; or
(3)
$900 for affected land of an acreage
greater than five acres and equal to or less than 10 acres; or
(4)
$1,200 for affected land of an acreage
greater than 10 acres and equal to or less than 20 acres; or
(5)
$1,500 for affected land of an acreage
greater than 20 acres and equal to or less than 30 acres; or
(6)
$2,000 for affected land of an acreage
greater than 30 acres. (c) Liability for fees authorized by this

Title shall be as follows: (1)
for persons
holding permits or approvals or subject to regulation under this Title on

January 1st in any year beginning with the year 1992, liability for fees shall
commence on January 1st; (2)
for
persons receiving new permits or approvals or subject to regulation under this

Title after September 1, 1991, liability for fees shall equal the annual fee
established pursuant to this Title and shall be prorated from the date of
issuance; (3)
for all persons
holding permits or approvals, or subject to regulation under this Title
liability to pay annual fees shall continue until such time as reclamation has
been completed and approved by the department and any required financial
security has been released, and shall be prorated to the date of approval by
the department. (d) Notwithstanding any other provision of law, counties, cities, towns and
villages shall be exempted from the fees for the permit, application, amendment
and renewal required by this Article. Notes
